oai_dc:dc.dc:title: No-till cultivation suppresses broad-leaved weeds but favours grasses
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jalli, H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weed management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We had two field trials (Jokioinen and Mietoinen) on heavy clay for four years (2001-2004). The main treatment was direct sowing or conventional sowing after autumn ploughing combined with spring rotary hoeing.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jalli, H. (2006) No-till cultivation suppresses broad-leaved weeds but favours grasses. In: Book of abstracts, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 2 (4), NJF Report, p. 20.
